Class CA

  • java.lang.Object
    • CA

  • public class CA
extends java.lang.Object
    CA (cellular automaton) class gets user input for variables that will determine the survival rate of cells within a grid system. The grid is determined for every generation and according to the user will save data to a file every X generations.
    Since:
    2013-09-30
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pash DeVore

    • Constructor Detail

      • CA

        public CA(int gridSize,
  double initProbability,
  int minN,
  int maxN,
  int maxGens,
  int mod,
  java.lang.String fileName)
   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for CA objects which instantiates all necessary class variables.
        Parameters:
        gridSize - Size of grid which must be between 5 and 50(inclusive) or an exception is thrown.
        initProbability - The probability value which must be between 0 and 1(exclusive) or an exception is thrown.
        minN - The minimum neighbors which must be between 1 and 4(inclusive) or an exception is thrown.
        maxN - The maximum neighbors which must be between 2 and 8(inclusive) or an exception is thrown.
        maxGens - The maximum number of generations that the program will run through to determine the surviving cells.
        mod - The modulus value which must be less than maxGens(inclusive) or an exception is thrown.
        fileName - The file name to which the determined generations will be saved. This must be a valid file name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameter is of conflicting type, fewer paramaters are used,or more parameters than necessary are passed to the constructor. Other reasons can be seen in the below description of parameters of the constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • createNextGeneration

        public boolean createNextGeneration()
        Determines survival and death of cells into the next generation.

        Each randomized boolean value within the grid is evaluated(true values are alive). This is done by looking at immediate neighbors (wrapped cells in the 2d array are also considered neighbors) and evaluating whether or not they are alive or dead. If the cell being evaluated has at least the minimum number of neighbors and less than the maximum number of neighbors, it will survive.

        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not you have reached the maximum generation value.

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the data in a 2d boolean array for the current generation.

        Upon determination of whether the user input for file name exists, is readable, and is writable, the method loops through the grid data and saves an interpretable image.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method used for getting user input for the values used in the CA constructor.
